title: [Self-Directed] Interest-Based Self-Regulated Learning Design Through STEM and Pop Culture Integration

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic STEM concepts and foundational computational thinking
context.additional_context: Project-based learning environment strengthening STEM competencies by integrating learners' personal interests and pop-culture content

learning_goals: Learners can analyze STEM elements in popular culture content (games, animations, webtoons, etc.) and propose real-life problem-solving models.
Learners can complete four or more STEM project cycles and write self-assessment reports using interest-based self-regulation strategies.
Learners can apply the computational thinking framework (decomposition, pattern recognition, abstraction, algorithm) to create digital prototypes that solve problems based on popular culture.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
